intro: Solanum diodontum, commonly known as the two-toothed nightshade, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant features simple, alternate leaves with a distinctive two-toothed appearance at the leaf margins. Its small, white or pale green flowers are usually clustered in terminal umbels. Solanum diodontum produces small, red berries that contain toxic compounds, making it potentially harmful to livestock and humans.
